018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli;
019
020import java.io.File;
021import java.io.FileInputStream;
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.io.InputStream;
024import java.nio.file.Files;
025import java.nio.file.Path;
026import java.sql.SQLException;
027import java.time.LocalDateTime;
028import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.HashMap;
032import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
033import java.util.List;
034import java.util.Map;
035import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
036import java.util.logging.FileHandler;
037import java.util.logging.Level;
038import java.util.logging.LogManager;
039import java.util.logging.Logger;
040import java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter;
041import java.util.stream.Collectors;
042import java.util.stream.Stream;

044import com.scivicslab.actoriac.NodeGroup;
045import com.scivicslab.actoriac.NodeGroupInterpreter;
046import com.scivicslab.actoriac.NodeGroupIIAR;

048import com.scivicslab.actoriac.log.H2LogStore;

052import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem;
053import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.kustomize.WorkflowKustomizer;
054
055import picocli.CommandLine;
056import picocli.CommandLine.Command;
057import picocli.CommandLine.Option;
058import picocli.CommandLine.Parameters;
059
060/**
061 * Command-line interface for executing actor-IaC workflows.
062 *
063 * <p>This CLI tool allows users to execute workflows defined in YAML, JSON, or XML
064 * format. It supports sub-workflows by recursively searching for workflow files
065 * in the specified directory.</p>
066 *
067 * <h2>Usage</h2>
068 * <pre>
069 * java -jar actor-IaC.jar -d /path/to/workflows -w main-workflow.yaml
070 * java -jar actor-IaC.jar --dir ./workflows --workflow deploy --threads 8
071 * </pre>
072 *
073 * <h2>Options</h2>
074 * <ul>
075 *   <li>{@code -d, --dir} - Directory containing workflow files (searched recursively)</li>
076 *   <li>{@code -w, --workflow} - Name of the main workflow to execute (with or without extension)</li>
077 *   <li>{@code -t, --threads} - Number of worker threads for CPU-bound operations (default: 4)</li>
078 *   <li>{@code -v, --verbose} - Enable verbose output</li>
079 * </ul>
080 *
081 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
082 * @since 2.7.0
083 */
084@Command(
085    name = "actor-iac",
086    mixinStandardHelpOptions = true,
087    version = "actor-IaC 2.10.0",
088    description = "Execute actor-IaC workflows defined in YAML, JSON, or XML format.",
089    subcommands = {LogsCLI.class, WorkflowCLI.ListWorkflowsCommand.class}
090)
091public class WorkflowCLI implements Callable<Integer> {
092
093    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(WorkflowCLI.class.getName());
094
095    @Option(
096        names = {"-d", "--dir"},
097        description = "Directory containing workflow files (searched recursively)"
098    )
099    private File workflowDir;
100
101    @Option(
102        names = {"-w", "--workflow"},
103        description = "Name of the main workflow to execute (with or without extension)"
104    )
105    private String workflowName;
106
107    @Option(
108        names = {"-i", "--inventory"},
109        description = "Path to Ansible inventory file (enables node-based execution)"
110    )
111    private File inventoryFile;
112
113    @Option(
114        names = {"-g", "--group"},
115        description = "Name of the host group to target (requires --inventory)",
116        defaultValue = "all"
117    )
118    private String groupName;
119
120    @Option(
121        names = {"-t", "--threads"},
122        description = "Number of worker threads for CPU-bound operations (default: ${DEFAULT-VALUE})",
123        defaultValue = "4"
124    )
125    private int threads;
126
127    @Option(
128        names = {"-v", "--verbose"},
129        description = "Enable verbose output"
130    )
131    private boolean verbose;
132
133    @Option(
134        names = {"-o", "--overlay"},
135        description = "Overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml for environment-specific configuration"
136    )
137    private File overlayDir;
138
139    @Option(
140        names = {"-l", "--log"},
141        description = "Log file path (default: actor-iac-YYYYMMDDHHmm.log in current directory)"
142    )
143    private File logFile;
144
145    @Option(
146        names = {"--no-log"},
147        description = "Disable file logging (output to console only)"
148    )
149    private boolean noLog;
150
151    @Option(
152        names = {"--log-db"},
153        description = "H2 database path for distributed logging (default: actor-iac-logs in workflow directory)"
154    )
155    private File logDbPath;
156
157    @Option(
158        names = {"--no-log-db"},
159        description = "Disable H2 database logging"
160    )
161    private boolean noLogDb;
162
163    @Option(
164        names = {"-k", "--ask-pass"},
165        description = "Prompt for SSH password (uses password authentication instead of ssh-agent)"
166    )
167    private boolean askPass;
168
169    @Option(
170        names = {"--limit"},
171        description = "Limit execution to specific hosts (comma-separated, e.g., '192.168.5.15' or '192.168.5.15,192.168.5.16')"
172    )
173    private String limitHosts;
174
175    @Option(
176        names = {"-L", "--list-workflows"},
177        description = "List workflows discovered under --dir and exit"
178    )
179    private boolean listWorkflows;
180
181    @Option(
182        names = {"-q", "--quiet"},
183        description = "Suppress all console output (stdout/stderr). Logs are still written to database."
184    )
185    private boolean quiet;
186
187    @Option(
188        names = {"--render-to"},
189        description = "Render overlay-applied workflows to specified directory (does not execute)"
190    )
191    private File renderToDir;
192
193    /** Cache of discovered workflow files: name -> File */
194    private final Map<String, File> workflowCache = new HashMap<>();
195
196    /** File handler for logging */
197    private FileHandler fileHandler;
198
199    /** Distributed log store (H2 database) */
200    private DistributedLogStore logStore;
201
202    /** Current session ID for distributed logging */
203    private long sessionId = -1;
204
205    /**
206     * Main entry point.
207     *
208     * @param args command line arguments
209     */
210    public static void main(String[] args) {
211        // Load logging configuration from resources
212        try (InputStream is = WorkflowCLI.class.getResourceAsStream("/logging.properties")) {
213            if (is != null) {
214                LogManager.getLogManager().readConfiguration(is);
215            }
216        } catch (IOException e) {
217            System.err.println("Warning: Failed to load logging.properties: " + e.getMessage());
218        }
219
220        if (args.length > 0 && "list".equalsIgnoreCase(args[0])) {
221            int exitCode = new CommandLine(new ListWorkflowsCommand())
222                .execute(Arrays.copyOfRange(args, 1, args.length));
223            System.exit(exitCode);
224        }
225
226        int exitCode = new CommandLine(new WorkflowCLI()).execute(args);
227        System.exit(exitCode);
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * Executes the workflow.
232     *
233     * @return exit code (0 for success, non-zero for failure)
234     */
235    @Override
236    public Integer call() {
237        // Validate required options when running workflow (not subcommands)
238        // --render-to only requires --dir and --overlay, not --workflow
239        if (renderToDir != null) {
240            if (workflowDir == null || overlayDir == null) {
241                if (!quiet) {
242                    System.err.println("--render-to requires both '--dir=<workflowDir>' and '--overlay=<overlayDir>'");
243                    CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
244                }
245                return 2;
246            }
247        } else if (workflowDir == null || workflowName == null) {
248            if (!quiet) {
249                System.err.println("Missing required options: '--dir=<workflowDir>', '--workflow=<workflowName>'");
250                CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
251            }
252            return 2;
253        }
254
255        // In quiet mode, suppress all console output
256        if (quiet) {
257            suppressConsoleOutput();
258        }
259
260        // Setup file logging
261        if (!noLog) {
262            try {
263                setupFileLogging();
264            } catch (IOException e) {
265                if (!quiet) {
266                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to setup file logging: " + e.getMessage());
267                }
268            }
269        }
270
271        // Configure log level based on verbose flag
272        configureLogLevel(verbose);
273
274        // Setup H2 log database (enabled by default, use --no-log-db to disable)
275        if (!noLogDb) {
276            if (logDbPath == null) {
277                // Default: actor-iac-logs in workflow directory
278                logDbPath = new File(workflowDir, "actor-iac-logs");
279            }
280            try {
281                setupLogDatabase();
282            } catch (SQLException e) {
283                if (!quiet) {
284                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to setup log database: " + e.getMessage());
285                }
286            }
287        }
288
289        try {
290            return executeMain();
291        } finally {
292            // Clean up resources
293            if (fileHandler != null) {
294                fileHandler.close();
295            }
296            if (logStore != null) {
297                try {
298                    logStore.close();
299                } catch (Exception e) {
300                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to close log database: " + e.getMessage());
301                }
302            }
303        }
304    }
305
306    /**
307     * Suppresses all console output (stdout/stderr) for quiet mode.
308     *
309     * <p>This method:</p>
310     * <ul>
311     *   <li>Removes ConsoleHandler from root logger</li>
312     *   <li>Redirects System.out and System.err to null streams</li>
313     * </ul>
314     */
315    private void suppressConsoleOutput() {
316        // Remove ConsoleHandler from root logger
317        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
318        for (java.util.logging.Handler handler : rootLogger.getHandlers()) {
319            if (handler instanceof java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler) {
320                rootLogger.removeHandler(handler);
321            }
322        }
323
324        // Redirect System.out and System.err to null
325        java.io.PrintStream nullStream = new java.io.PrintStream(java.io.OutputStream.nullOutputStream());
326        System.setOut(nullStream);
327        System.setErr(nullStream);
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Sets up H2 database for distributed logging.
332     *
333     * @throws SQLException if database connection fails
334     */
335    private void setupLogDatabase() throws SQLException {
336        Path dbPath = logDbPath.toPath();
337        logStore = new H2LogStore(dbPath);
338        // Note: In quiet mode, System.out is already redirected to null
339        System.out.println("Log database: " + logDbPath.getAbsolutePath() + ".mv.db");
340    }
341
342    /**
343     * Sets up file logging with default or specified log file.
344     *
345     * @throws IOException if log file cannot be created
346     */
347    private void setupFileLogging() throws IOException {
348        String logFilePath;
349        if (logFile != null) {
350            logFilePath = logFile.getAbsolutePath();
351        } else {
352            // Generate default log file name: actor-iac-YYYYMMDDHHmm.log
353            String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMddHHmm"));
354            logFilePath = "actor-iac-" + timestamp + ".log";
355        }
356
357        fileHandler = new FileHandler(logFilePath, false);
358        fileHandler.setFormatter(new SimpleFormatter());
359
360        // Add handler to root logger to capture all logs
361        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
362        rootLogger.addHandler(fileHandler);
363
364        System.out.println("Logging to: " + logFilePath);
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * Configures log level based on verbose flag.
369     *
370     * <p>When verbose mode is enabled, sets log level to FINE to show
371     * detailed debug information including workflow selection logic.
372     * Otherwise, sets log level to INFO for normal operation.</p>
373     *
374     * @param verbose true to enable FINE level logging
375     */
376    private void configureLogLevel(boolean verbose) {
377        Level targetLevel = verbose ? Level.FINE : Level.INFO;
378
379        // Configure root logger level
380        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
381        rootLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
382
383        // Configure handlers to respect the new level
384        for (java.util.logging.Handler handler : rootLogger.getHandlers()) {
385            handler.setLevel(targetLevel);
386        }
387
388        // Configure POJO-actor Interpreter logger
389        Logger interpreterLogger = Logger.getLogger("com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter");
390        interpreterLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
391
392        if (verbose) {
393            LOG.info("Verbose mode enabled - log level set to FINE");
394        }
395    }
396
397    /**
398     * Main execution logic.
399     *
400     * @return exit code (0 for success, non-zero for failure)
401     */
402    private Integer executeMain() {
403        // Validate workflow directory
404        if (!workflowDir.exists()) {
405            LOG.severe("Workflow directory does not exist: " + workflowDir);
406            return 1;
407        }
408        if (workflowDir == null) {
409            LOG.severe("Workflow directory is required. Use -d/--dir to specify it.");
410            return 1;
411        }
412
413        if (!workflowDir.isDirectory()) {
414            LOG.severe("Not a directory: " + workflowDir);
415            return 1;
416        }
417
418        // Scan workflow directory recursively
419        LOG.info("Scanning workflow directory: " + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
420        scanWorkflowDirectory(workflowDir.toPath());
421
422        if (verbose) {
423            LOG.info("Discovered " + workflowCache.size() + " workflow files:");
424            workflowCache.forEach((name, file) ->
425                LOG.info("  " + name + " -> " + file.getPath()));
426        }
427
428        if (listWorkflows) {
429            printWorkflowList();
430            return 0;
431        }
432
433        // Handle --render-to option
434        if (renderToDir != null) {
435            return renderOverlayWorkflows();
436        }
437
438        if (workflowName == null || workflowName.isBlank()) {
439            LOG.severe("Workflow name is required unless --list-workflows is specified.");
440            return 1;
441        }
442
443        // Find main workflow
444        File mainWorkflowFile = findWorkflowFile(workflowName);
445        if (mainWorkflowFile == null) {
446            LOG.severe("Workflow not found: " + workflowName);
447            LOG.info("Available workflows: " + workflowCache.keySet());
448            return 1;
449        }
450
451        // Validate overlay directory if specified
452        if (overlayDir != null) {
453            if (!overlayDir.exists()) {
454                LOG.severe("Overlay directory does not exist: " + overlayDir);
455                return 1;
456            }
457            if (!overlayDir.isDirectory()) {
458                LOG.severe("Overlay path is not a directory: " + overlayDir);
459                return 1;
460            }
461        }
462
463        LOG.info("=== actor-IaC Workflow CLI ===");
464        LOG.info("Workflow directory: " + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
465        LOG.info("Main workflow: " + mainWorkflowFile.getName());
466        if (overlayDir != null) {
467            LOG.info("Overlay: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
468        }
469        LOG.info("Worker threads: " + threads);
470
471        // Execute workflow (use local inventory if none specified)
472        return executeWorkflow(mainWorkflowFile);
473    }
474
475    /**
476     * Renders overlay-applied workflows to the specified directory.
477     *
478     * <p>This method uses WorkflowKustomizer to apply overlays and writes
479     * the resulting YAML files to the output directory. This is useful for
480     * debugging overlay configurations without executing the workflow.</p>
481     *
482     * @return exit code (0 for success, non-zero for failure)
483     */
484    private Integer renderOverlayWorkflows() {
485        if (overlayDir == null) {
486            LOG.severe("--render-to requires --overlay to be specified");
487            return 1;
488        }
489
490        try {
491            // Create output directory if it doesn't exist
492            if (!renderToDir.exists()) {
493                if (!renderToDir.mkdirs()) {
494                    LOG.severe("Failed to create output directory: " + renderToDir);
495                    return 1;
496                }
497            }
498
499            LOG.info("=== Rendering Overlay-Applied Workflows ===");
500            LOG.info("Overlay directory: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
501            LOG.info("Output directory: " + renderToDir.getAbsolutePath());
502
503            WorkflowKustomizer kustomizer = new WorkflowKustomizer();
504            Map<String, Map<String, Object>> workflows = kustomizer.build(overlayDir.toPath());
505
506            org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml yaml = new org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml();
507
508            for (Map.Entry<String, Map<String, Object>> entry : workflows.entrySet()) {
509                String fileName = entry.getKey();
510                Map<String, Object> workflowContent = entry.getValue();
511
512                Path outputPath = renderToDir.toPath().resolve(fileName);
513
514                // Add header comment
515                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
516                sb.append("# Rendered from overlay: ").append(overlayDir.getName()).append("\n");
517                sb.append("# Source: ").append(fileName).append("\n");
518                sb.append("# Generated: ").append(LocalDateTime.now()).append("\n");
519                sb.append("#\n");
520                sb.append(yaml.dump(workflowContent));
521
522                Files.writeString(outputPath, sb.toString());
523                LOG.info("  Written: " + outputPath);
524            }
525
526            LOG.info("Rendered " + workflows.size() + " workflow(s) to " + renderToDir.getAbsolutePath());
527            return 0;
528
529        } catch (IOException e) {
530            LOG.severe("Failed to render workflows: " + e.getMessage());
531            return 1;
532        } catch (Exception e) {
533            LOG.severe("Error during rendering: " + e.getMessage());
534            e.printStackTrace();
535            return 1;
536        }
537    }
538
539    /**
540     * Executes workflow with node-based execution.
541     *
542     * <p>This method creates a proper workflow execution hierarchy:</p>
543     * <ol>
544     *   <li>Create IIActorSystem</li>
545     *   <li>Create NodeGroupIIAR and register with system (using inventory or localhost)</li>
546     *   <li>Create main Interpreter to execute the main workflow</li>
547     *   <li>Main workflow calls nodeGroup.createNodeActors and nodeGroup.apply</li>
548     *   <li>apply + runWorkflow executes sub-workflows on each node</li>
549     * </ol>
550     *
551     * @param mainWorkflowFile the main workflow file
552     * @return exit code
553     */
554    private Integer executeWorkflow(File mainWorkflowFile) {
555        NodeGroup nodeGroup;
556
557        // Prompt for password if --ask-pass is specified
558        String sshPassword = null;
559        if (askPass) {
560            sshPassword = promptForPassword("SSH password: ");
561            if (sshPassword == null) {
562                LOG.severe("Password input cancelled");
563                return 1;
564            }
565        }
566
567        IIActorSystem system = new IIActorSystem("actor-iac-cli", threads);
568
569        // Start log session if log database is configured
570        if (logStore != null) {
571            String overlayName = overlayDir != null ? overlayDir.getName() : null;
572            String inventoryName = inventoryFile != null ? inventoryFile.getName() : null;
573            sessionId = logStore.startSession(workflowName, overlayName, inventoryName, 1); // nodeCount will be updated later
574            logStore.log(sessionId, "cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Starting workflow: " + workflowName);
575        }
576
577        try {
578            if (inventoryFile != null) {
579                // Use specified inventory file
580                if (!inventoryFile.exists()) {
581                    LOG.severe("Inventory file does not exist: " + inventoryFile);
582                    logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Inventory file does not exist: " + inventoryFile);
583                    return 1;
584                }
585                LOG.info("Inventory: " + inventoryFile.getAbsolutePath());
586                nodeGroup = new NodeGroup.Builder()
587                    .withInventory(new FileInputStream(inventoryFile))
588                    .build();
589            } else {
590                // Use empty NodeGroup for local execution
591                LOG.info("Inventory: (none - using localhost)");
592                nodeGroup = new NodeGroup();
593            }
594
595            // Set SSH password if provided
596            if (sshPassword != null) {
597                nodeGroup.setSshPassword(sshPassword);
598                LOG.info("Authentication: password");
599            } else {
600                LOG.info("Authentication: ssh-agent");
601            }
602
603            // Set host limit if provided
604            if (limitHosts != null) {
605                nodeGroup.setHostLimit(limitHosts);
606                LOG.info("Host limit: " + limitHosts);
607            }
608
609            // Step 1: Create NodeGroupInterpreter (wraps NodeGroup with Interpreter capabilities)
610            NodeGroupInterpreter nodeGroupInterpreter = new NodeGroupInterpreter(nodeGroup, system);
611            nodeGroupInterpreter.setWorkflowBaseDir(workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
612            if (overlayDir != null) {
613                nodeGroupInterpreter.setOverlayDir(overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
614            }
615            if (verbose) {
616                nodeGroupInterpreter.setVerbose(true);
617            }
618
619            // Inject log store into interpreter for node-level logging
620            if (logStore != null) {
621                nodeGroupInterpreter.setLogStore(logStore, sessionId);
622            }
623
624            // Step 2: Create NodeGroupIIAR and register with system
625            NodeGroupIIAR nodeGroupActor = new NodeGroupIIAR("nodeGroup", nodeGroupInterpreter, system);
626            system.addIIActor(nodeGroupActor);
627
628            // Step 3: Load the main workflow (with overlay if specified)
629            ActionResult loadResult = loadMainWorkflow(nodeGroupActor, mainWorkflowFile, overlayDir);
630            if (!loadResult.isSuccess()) {
631                LOG.severe("Failed to load workflow: " + loadResult.getResult());
632                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Failed to load workflow: " + loadResult.getResult());
633                endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
634                return 1;
635            }
636
637            // Step 4: Execute the workflow
638            LOG.info("Starting workflow execution...");
639            LOG.info("-".repeat(50));
640            logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Starting workflow execution");
641
642            long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
643            ActionResult result = nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("runUntilEnd", "[10000]");
644            long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
645
646            LOG.info("-".repeat(50));
647            if (result.isSuccess()) {
648                LOG.info("Workflow completed successfully: " + result.getResult());
649                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Workflow completed successfully in " + duration + "ms");
650                endSession(SessionStatus.COMPLETED);
651                return 0;
652            } else {
653                LOG.severe("Workflow failed: " + result.getResult());
654                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Workflow failed: " + result.getResult());
655                endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
656                return 1;
657            }
658
659        } catch (Exception e) {
660            LOG.log(Level.SEVERE, "Workflow execution failed", e);
661            logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Exception: " + e.getMessage());
662            endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
663            return 1;
664        } finally {
665            system.terminate();
666        }
667    }
668
669    /**
670     * Logs a message to the distributed log store if available.
671     */
672    private void logToDb(String nodeId, LogLevel level, String message) {
673        if (logStore != null && sessionId >= 0) {
674            logStore.log(sessionId, nodeId, level, message);
675        }
676    }
677
678    /**
679     * Ends the current session with the given status.
680     */
681    private void endSession(SessionStatus status) {
682        if (logStore != null && sessionId >= 0) {
683            logStore.endSession(sessionId, status);
684        }
685    }
686
687    /**
688     * Prompts for a password from the console.
689     *
690     * <p>Uses System.console() for secure input (password is not echoed).
691     * Falls back to System.in if console is not available (e.g., in IDE).</p>
692     *
693     * @param prompt the prompt message to display
694     * @return the entered password, or null if input failed
695     */
696    private String promptForPassword(String prompt) {
697        java.io.Console console = System.console();
698        if (console != null) {
699            // Secure input - password not echoed
700            char[] passwordChars = console.readPassword(prompt);
701            if (passwordChars != null) {
702                return new String(passwordChars);
703            }
704            return null;
705        } else {
706            // Fallback for environments without console (e.g., IDE)
707            System.out.print(prompt);
708            try (java.util.Scanner scanner = new java.util.Scanner(System.in)) {
709                if (scanner.hasNextLine()) {
710                    return scanner.nextLine();
711                }
712            }
713            return null;
714        }
715    }
716
717    /**
718     * Scans the directory recursively for workflow files.
719     *
720     * @param dir the directory to scan
721     */
722    private void scanWorkflowDirectory(Path dir) {
723        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.walk(dir)) {
724            paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
725                 .filter(this::isWorkflowFile)
726                 .forEach(this::registerWorkflowFile);
727        } catch (IOException e) {
728            LOG.warning("Error scanning directory: " + e.getMessage());
729        }
730    }
731
732    /**
733     * Checks if a file is a workflow file (YAML, JSON, or XML).
734     *
735     * @param path the file path
736     * @return true if it's a workflow file
737     */
738    private boolean isWorkflowFile(Path path) {
739        String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
740        return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml") ||
741               name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
742    }
743
744    /**
745     * Registers a workflow file in the cache.
746     *
747     * @param path the file path
748     */
749    private void registerWorkflowFile(Path path) {
750        File file = path.toFile();
751        String fileName = file.getName();
752
753        // Register with full filename
754        workflowCache.put(fileName, file);
755
756        // Register without extension
757        int dotIndex = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
758        if (dotIndex > 0) {
759            String baseName = fileName.substring(0, dotIndex);
760            // Only register base name if not already taken by another file
761            workflowCache.putIfAbsent(baseName, file);
762        }
763    }
764
765    /**
766     * Finds a workflow file by name.
767     *
768     * @param name the workflow name (with or without extension)
769     * @return the workflow file, or null if not found
770     */
771    public File findWorkflowFile(String name) {
772        // Try exact match first
773        File file = workflowCache.get(name);
774        if (file != null) {
775            return file;
776        }
777
778        // Try with common extensions
779        String[] extensions = {".yaml", ".yml", ".json", ".xml"};
780        for (String ext : extensions) {
781            file = workflowCache.get(name + ext);
782            if (file != null) {
783                return file;
784            }
785        }
786
787        return null;
788    }
789
790    /**
791     * Loads the main workflow file with optional overlay support.
792     *
793     * @param nodeGroupActor the actor to load the workflow into
794     * @param workflowFile the workflow file to load
795     * @param overlayDir the overlay directory (may be null)
796     * @return the result of the load operation
797     */
798    private ActionResult loadMainWorkflow(NodeGroupIIAR nodeGroupActor, File workflowFile, File overlayDir) {
799        LOG.info("Loading workflow: " + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath());
800        logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Loading workflow: " + workflowFile.getName());
801
802        String loadArg;
803        if (overlayDir != null) {
804            // Pass both workflow path and overlay directory
805            loadArg = "[\"" + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath() + "\", \"" + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath() + "\"]";
806            LOG.fine("Loading with overlay: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
807        } else {
808            // Load without overlay
809            loadArg = "[\"" + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath() + "\"]";
810        }
811
812        return nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("readYaml", loadArg);
813    }
814
815    private void printWorkflowList() {
816        List<WorkflowDisplay> displays = scanWorkflowsForDisplay(workflowDir);
817
818        if (displays.isEmpty()) {
819            System.out.println("No workflow files found under "
820                + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
821            return;
822        }
823
824        System.out.println("Available workflows (directory: "
825            + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath() + ")");
826        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
827        System.out.printf("%-4s %-25s %-35s %s%n", "#", "File (-w)", "Path", "Workflow Name (in logs)");
828        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
829        int index = 1;
830        for (WorkflowDisplay display : displays) {
831            String workflowName = display.workflowName() != null ? display.workflowName() : "(no name)";
832            System.out.printf("%2d.  %-25s %-35s %s%n",
833                index++, display.baseName(), display.relativePath(), workflowName);
834        }
835        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
836        System.out.println("Use -w <File> with the names shown in the 'File (-w)' column.");
837    }
838
839    private static String getBaseName(String fileName) {
840        int dotIndex = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
841        if (dotIndex > 0) {
842            return fileName.substring(0, dotIndex);
843        }
844        return fileName;
845    }
846
847    private static String relativize(Path base, Path target) {
848        try {
849            return base.relativize(target).toString();
850        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
851            return target.toAbsolutePath().toString();
852        }
853    }
854
855    private static List<WorkflowDisplay> scanWorkflowsForDisplay(File directory) {
856        if (directory == null) {
857            return List.of();
858        }
859
860        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.walk(directory.toPath())) {
861            Map<String, File> uniqueFiles = new LinkedHashMap<>();
862            paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
863                 .filter(path -> {
864                     String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
865                     return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml")
866                         || name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
867                 })
868                 .forEach(path -> uniqueFiles.putIfAbsent(path.toFile().getAbsolutePath(), path.toFile()));
869
870            Path basePath = directory.toPath();
871            return uniqueFiles.values().stream()
872                .map(file -> new WorkflowDisplay(
873                    getBaseName(file.getName()),
874                    relativize(basePath, file.toPath()),
875                    extractWorkflowName(file)))
876                .sorted(Comparator.comparing(WorkflowDisplay::baseName, String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER))
877                .collect(Collectors.toList());
878        } catch (IOException e) {
879            System.err.println("Failed to scan workflows: " + e.getMessage());
880            return List.of();
881        }
882    }
883
884    /**
885     * Extracts the workflow name from a YAML/JSON/XML file.
886     *
887     * <p>Looks for "name:" field in YAML/JSON files.</p>
888     *
889     * @param file the workflow file
890     * @return the workflow name, or null if not found
891     */
892    private static String extractWorkflowName(File file) {
893        String fileName = file.getName().toLowerCase();
894        if (fileName.endsWith(".yaml") || fileName.endsWith(".yml")) {
895            return extractNameFromYaml(file);
896        } else if (fileName.endsWith(".json")) {
897            return extractNameFromJson(file);
898        }
899        return null;
900    }
901
902    /**
903     * Extracts name field from YAML file using simple line parsing.
904     */
905    private static String extractNameFromYaml(File file) {
906        try (java.io.BufferedReader reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.FileReader(file))) {
907            String line;
908            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
909                line = line.trim();
910                // Look for "name: value" at the top level (not indented)
911                if (line.startsWith("name:")) {
912                    String value = line.substring(5).trim();
913                    // Remove quotes if present
914                    if ((value.startsWith("\"") && value.endsWith("\"")) ||
915                        (value.startsWith("'") && value.endsWith("'"))) {
916                        value = value.substring(1, value.length() - 1);
917                    }
918                    return value.isEmpty() ? null : value;
919                }
920                // Stop if we hit a steps: or other major section
921                if (line.startsWith("steps:") || line.startsWith("vertices:")) {
922                    break;
923                }
924            }
925        } catch (IOException e) {
926            // Ignore and return null
927        }
928        return null;
929    }
930
931    /**
932     * Extracts name field from JSON file.
933     */
934    private static String extractNameFromJson(File file) {
935        try (java.io.FileReader reader = new java.io.FileReader(file)) {
936            org.json.JSONTokener tokener = new org.json.JSONTokener(reader);
937            org.json.JSONObject json = new org.json.JSONObject(tokener);
938            return json.optString("name", null);
939        } catch (Exception e) {
940            // Ignore and return null
941        }
942        return null;
943    }
944
945    /**
946     * Record for displaying workflow information.
947     *
948     * @param baseName the base name of the workflow file (without extension)
949     * @param relativePath the relative path to the workflow file
950     * @param workflowName the workflow name defined in the YAML file (name: field)
951     */
952    private static record WorkflowDisplay(String baseName, String relativePath, String workflowName) {}
953
954    @Command(
955        name = "list",
956        description = "List workflows discovered under --dir and exit",
957        mixinStandardHelpOptions = true
958    )
959    static class ListWorkflowsCommand implements Callable<Integer> {
960
961        @Option(
962            names = {"-d", "--dir"},
963            required = true,
964            description = "Directory containing workflow files (searched recursively)"
965        )
966        private File workflowDir;
967
968        @Override
969        public Integer call() {
970            if (!workflowDir.isDirectory()) {
971                System.err.println("Not a directory: " + workflowDir);
972                return 1;
973            }
974            List<WorkflowDisplay> displays = scanWorkflowsForDisplay(workflowDir);
975            if (displays.isEmpty()) {
976                System.out.println("No workflow files found under "
977                    + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
978                return 0;
979            }
980
981            System.out.println("Available workflows (directory: "
982                + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath() + ")");
983            System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
984            System.out.printf("%-4s %-25s %-35s %s%n", "#", "File (-w)", "Path", "Workflow Name (in logs)");
985            System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
986            int index = 1;
987            for (WorkflowDisplay display : displays) {
988                String workflowName = display.workflowName() != null ? display.workflowName() : "(no name)";
989                System.out.printf("%2d.  %-25s %-35s %s%n",
990                    index++, display.baseName(), display.relativePath(), workflowName);
991            }
992            System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
993            System.out.println("Use -w <File> with the names shown in the 'File (-w)' column.");
994            return 0;
995        }
996    }
997}
